meanings.definition: Produced by the action of the earth or land.
meanings.sent1: The terrigenous rocks were formed by the powerful forces of nature.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the terrigenous soil to understand its composition.
meanings.sent3: The terrigenous mountains seemed to whisper ancient tales of the land.
meanings.sent4: Her terrigenous artwork reflected the raw beauty of the natural world.
meanings.sent5: The terrigenous landscape painted a picture of rugged wilderness.

meanings.definition: Originating from or found on land.
meanings.sent1: The terrigenous plants thrived in the rich soil of the forest.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists discovered terrigenous artifacts buried beneath the ground.
meanings.sent3: The terrigenous creatures scurried through the dense undergrowth.
meanings.sent4: His terrigenous roots kept him connected to his homeland.
meanings.sent5: The terrigenous smell of pine filled the air with nostalgia.
